intro: Knautia arvensis var. canescens, commonly known as the grey knautia, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The species is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
